description: Initial dashboard to provide a quick overview of how the cluster is working.

options.content:
Welcome to the PowerScale Data Insights.

This tool was designed to give customer and Dell UDS Presales a simple easy way to collect and share relevant telemetry information from OneFS Clusters. Feel free to integrate with other Grafana dashbaords and data sources to create application based mash-ups and provide a deeper insight.

On this dashboard you will find relevant cluster wide statistics that can give a quick glimpse as to what is happening across a broad set of metrics. It can be used to identify and drill down on time ranges of interest. Use these time ranges on other dashbaords to further analysis.

Usage Notes

  • Use the cluster and other pull downs to select the cluster and protocol(s) of interest. A seperate chart will be displayed for each protocol chosen.
  • Use highlight with your mouse the time period you want to zoom into or use the pull downs at the top right to select specific time periods.
  • Note that by default the dates and time displayed are in your browserâ€™s time zone, not the source cluster. You can get it to display in UTC via the settings under the little gear symbol at the top of the page.
  • If there is a legend displayed you can click on elements within it to hide or display items, etc.
  • Click on the title of the chart and then the horizontal bars icon at the left to show/hide the legend and get a CSV export of the data.
  • The charts are displayed to connect the data points and the null values so drop-outs will look weird.

targets.query: SELECT max("out_rate") FROM "cluster.protostats.$proto.total" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)
SELECT max("in_rate") FROM "cluster.protostats.$proto.total" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.description: This is the CPU contributions from OneFS.  It is a stacked chart and the totals will be measured along with the contribution from each piece.  Use the hover tooltip to get exact values along the chart.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value")  / 100 FROM "cluster.cpu.user.avg" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "node" =~ /^$node$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node" fill(null)
SELECT mean("value")  / 100 FROM "cluster.cpu.user.avg" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "node" =~ /^$node$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node" fill(null)
SELECT mean("value")  / 100 FROM "cluster.cpu.user.avg" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND "node" =~ /^$node$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "node" fill(null)

panels.title: Cluster CPU Breakdown - $cluster

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /node.ifs.heat.(.*).total/ WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("time_avg")  / 1000 FROM "cluster.protostats.$protocol" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "class_name",  "op_name" fill(null)

options.content:
# L1 Cache
Or Level 1 cache is a client side cache that caches file objects as they are accessed on that particular node.

targets.query: SELECT max("l2_data_prefetch_hit") /max("l2_data_prefetch_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)
SELECT max("l2_meta_prefetch_hit") /max("l2_meta_prefetch_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)
SELECT max("l1_data_read_hit") /max("l1_data_read_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)
SELECT max("l1_meta_read_hit") /max("l1_meta_read_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)

options.content:
# L2 Cache
Level 2 cache is a back-end cache that caches file block that reside on that particular node.

targets.query: SELECT max("l2_data_prefetch_hit") /max("l2_data_prefetch_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)
SELECT max("l2_meta_prefetch_hit") /max("l2_meta_prefetch_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)
SELECT max("l2_meta_read_hit") /max("l2_meta_read_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)
SELECT max("l2_data_read_hit") /max("l2_data_read_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)
SELECT max("l2_meta_read_hit") /max("l2_meta_read_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)

options.content:
# L3 Cache
Level 3 cache is an SSD backed cache that works with L2 Cache and contains blocks and metadata that are local to that particular node.

targets.query: SELECT max("l3_data_read_hit") /max("l3_data_read_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)
SELECT max("l3_meta_read_hit") /max("l3_meta_read_start") FROM "node.ifs.cache" WHERE "cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m) fill(null)

panels.description: THis is a stacked graph so the total R+W is plotted for the overall B/W.  At the same time showing the contributions from each.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "cluster.disk.bytes.in.rate" WHERE ("cluster" =~ /^$cluster$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Disk IO for $cluster

title: 1. PowerScale Cluster Overview
